text: RT @SianieRoo: Also appalled. The cause of the hazardous fumes is greed& money @RedIndustries2 . And the inability to stop it comes down to‚Ä¶

@BenM_Anderson @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @Feargal_Sharkey @PHE_uk @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe @ChrisGPackham @RedIndustries2 Thank you. It's having a massive impact on domestic animals and wildlife as well as the ecosystem in general. We have badger sets on the periphery of the landfill & they're affected during breading season. I believe bee's & other pollinators are also under attack.
@StinkStopthe

urls.title: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs terrifying‚Äô: the English village overwhelmed by landfill stink
urls.description: For miles around Walleys Quarry near Newcastle-under-Lyme, people have reported waking up in the night struggling to breathe

text: This is in Silverdale, #NewcastleUnderLyme #Staffordshire - landfill related. Come on, @EnvAgency - #StopTheStink.    https://t.co/pj1wIergwr

@HelenVi00175623 @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @Feargal_Sharkey @PHE_uk @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe @ChrisGPackham Oh don't get me started on that topic! Right now though, I genuinely think the @RedIndustries2 Walleys Quarry disaster is the most urgent in the country. And I  imagine it's a wildlife as well as a human one.

@HelenVi00175623 @SianieRoo @EnvAgency @JamesBevanEA @Cap_it_off @Feargal_Sharkey @PHE_uk @DefraGovUK @StinkStopthe Yep. There's also been a spate of instances of wanton destruction of wildlife and habitat, followed by EA intervention, followed by some shrugging of shoulders. The Carbis Bay Hotel cutting down a swath of coastal woodland to host a G7 summit on climate change, for example.

@Janeclaremotram @LFC_Jacqui @seftoncouncil @EnvAgencyNW (2/2) This is what we are currently focusing on and we will keep you updated as this element of work progresses.  It was never our intention to cause any upset to residents who have been very patient during this project.

This project nears the stage of returning the area back to local residents so it‚Äôs important we work together to leave a space behind for the community to enjoy. (1/2)
